intro: Galium alpicola, commonly known as the alpine bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to high-altitude regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers, typically blooming in late summer. Galium alpicola thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. Its low-growing habit and delicate appearance make it a distinctive component of alpine flora.
